<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Manipulative Charm](/Feats.aspx?ID=3547) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 58</row>

**Archetype** [Vampire](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=181)

**Prerequisites**
[Vampire Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3545); Trained in [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) or Trained in [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6)

</column>

---

Against [humanoids](/Traits.aspx?ID=91), you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) checks to [Lie](/Actions.aspx?ID=47), and to [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) checks to [Gather Information](/Actions.aspx?ID=49) and [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50).

 Once per day, you can cast [_charm_](/Spells.aspx?ID=34) as a divine innate spell using your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163) trait. At 5th level and every 2 levels thereafter, the spell is heightened by an additional level, to a maximum of a 9th-level charm when you are 19th level.

<title level="2">Manipulative Charm leads to...</title>
[Dominating Gaze](/Feats.aspx?ID=3556)
